ygData.subject: Re: Ward The Undead
ygData.msgSnippet: Grim Aura is cast on yourself and boosts your HP considerably as well as AC.  It adds 20 to my hp.
ygData.messageBody:
Grim Aura is cast on yourself and boosts your HP considerably as well as AC. It adds
20 to my hp.

James wrote:

> From: "James" <redevil000@...>
>
> Speaking of Grim Aura, what is it? It's a relatively new spell so none of
> the websites seem to have it.
> BTW,
> Sypher
> level 6, gnome
> Innoruuk
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Shadow Panther <shdwpanther@...>
> To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
> Date: Sunday, April 18, 1999 7:48 PM
> Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] Re: Ward The Undead
>
> >From: "Shadow Panther" <shdwpanther@...>
> >
> >
> > Greetings again folks,
> >
> > The spell is cast directly on the opponet as LifeSpike is cast
> >directly on your opponet, so you just target the undead as a regular victem
> >before casting. As for the price of the spells, I think you paid about
> >average as I get the same prices with a Charisma of 80 in the city of
> >Qeynos. Vampiric Embrace I think as a general rule should be at the bottom
> >of one's to-buy list, but could be handy if you find yourself weaponless
> >(lost your corps), and will have to fight hand-to-hand. Sometimes you just
> >can't help it. In that case, cast Grim Aura as well, but try to avoid
> >fights at all cost of course.
> >
> > ~Myskyra / Tunare
> >
> >----- Original Message -----
> >From: <stackers@...>
> >To: <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
> >Sent: Sunday, April 18, 1999 10:23 AM
> >Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] Re: Ward The Undead
> >
> >
> >> From: stackers@...
> >>
> >> I think you wasted coin on Vampiric Embrace (unless a Shadow Knight uses
> >it,
> >> as it requires you to use your barehands to fight). Ward Undead is our
> >> first direct damage spell. I used it and my pet exclusively to go from
> >lvl
> >> 8 to lvl 12. I target a skell (yellow /con if possible), fire away with
> >> Ward Undead, attack with my pet, and fire with Ward Undead. Repeat until
> >> the skell is a pile of bones. At first, I had to engage in combat to
> draw
> >> attention from the skell away from my pet. AWSOME SPELL!!!
> >>
> >> As anyone battled Undead chess pieces in ButcherBlock??
> >>
> >> Roeland, Gnome Necro on Tunare
> >>
> >> -----Original Message-----
> >> From: Douglas Kendall <lachdanan@...>
> >> To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
> >> Date: Sunday, April 18, 1999 10:07 AM
> >> Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] Re: Ward The Undead
> >>
> >>
> >> >From: Douglas Kendall <lachdanan@...>
> >> >
> >> >OK I undersand that but how does it come into play? You cast it on
> >yourself
> >> so how do
> >> >you damage the undead? By striking them? Explain how you use it please.
> >> And one other
> >> >thing; Being a Gnome I bought my key L8 spells from Merchants in my
> guild
> >> area. I paid
> >> >4.5 P ea for Lessor Shielding, Bone Walk, and Vampiric Embrace. Is this
> >> normal? Man
> >> >took all the $ I had.
> >> >
> >> >Shadow Panther wrote:
> >> >
> >> >> From: "Shadow Panther" <shdwpanther@...>
> >> >>
> >> >> I hear it does 38(+1/level) dam to undead. In other words, a base
> >> >> damage of 38, and + 1 for each level after eight. Say, you get 40 dam
> >to
> >> >> undead once you reach 10th level. Something like that.
> >> >>
> >> >> That may not be 100% correct, but it's what I've been told at
> >least.
> >> >> And it is doing 38pts of dam for me at level eight at the moment. Nice
> >> >> spell. Looking forward to Dominate Undead. Going to have fun with
> >some
> >> >> Dreads....Just have a long way to go.
> >> >>
> >> >> ~Myskyra
> >> >>
> >> >> ----- Original Message -----
> >> >> From: Douglas Kendall <lachdanan@...>
> >> >> To: <eq_necromancer@onelist.com>
> >> >> Sent: Saturday, April 17, 1999 6:20 PM
> >> >> Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] Ward The Undead
> >> >>
> >> >> > From: Douglas Kendall <lachdanan@...>
> >> >> >
> >> >> > What does that spell do? How does it work as you cast it on
> >yourself,
> >> >> > but no icon shows like aura, unless it replaces it? Play on Povar,
> a
> >> >> > Gnome, and need some player friends.
